medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at birth with normal skin until 2 weeks of age, when the patient experienced intense erythema, edema, vesiculation, and crusting on sun-exposed areas of the body after being placed in an incubator adjacent to a window. At 2 months of age, associated findings included glaucoma, retinopathy, growth retardation, osteopenia, and hemolytic anemia with marked splenomegaly.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Born prematurely at 34 weeks of gestation after a pregnancy complicated by oligohydramnios and hydrops fetalis. Confirmed diagnosis of congenital erythropoietic porphyria (CEP) based on porphyrin profile analysis.
medical_history.family_history: Both nonconsanguineous parents are carriers of the C73R mutation associated with CEP.
